thread.title: Rams are considered likely to move on from free agent WR Kenny Britt
thread.title_full: Rams are considered likely to move on from free agent WR Kenny Britt

title: Rams are considered likely to move on from free agent WR Kenny Britt
text:
By: Bryan Kalbrosky | 6 hours ago 
Under new head coach Sean McVay, the Los Angeles Rams are reportedly unlikely to retain their No. 1 receiver, Kenny Britt. 
Last season, Britt was the first Rams receiver to have more than 1,000 yards since 2007. According to Pro Football Focus, he was also the best “crossing route” wideout in the NFL. Related: Kenny Britt was the best crossing route receiver in 2016 
But according to a recent update from Alden Gonzalez, chances are the Rams will not re-sign Britt ( via ESPN ): 
“The veteran receiver is coming off his first 1,000-yard-receiving season, which was also the Rams’ first since 2007, and will now be an unrestricted free agent. Chances are that the Rams, now under the direction of the offensive-minded Sean McVay, will move on. They’ll prioritize other targets in free agency, perhaps the likes of DeSean Jackson, Pierre Garcon , Kenny Stills and the real prize, Alshon Jeffery. Britt may be better off moving on, too. He’s an eight-year veteran, coming off his third season with the Rams, and may want to pair with a more established quarterback than Jared Goff.” 
While Gonzalez mentions other free agent options, there’s also the option that Los Angeles decides to take a wideout with one of its first few picks in April’s draft. 
Even if the Rams do not keep Britt on their roster for next season, they have various other options to replace his production with extra cap space saved on his salary. Related: Alshon Jeffery , desean jackson , kenny britt , kenny stills , la rams , la rams news , Los Angeles Rams , pierre garcon , Rams , rams free agency , rams news , rams updates , sean mcvay , Rams Free Agency Bryan Kalbrosky University of Oregon alum who has published with FOX Sports, Bleacher Report, LA Weekly, Huffington Post and various other publications. Email: bryan.kalbrosky@gmail.com.
